intro: Lonicera trichosantha f. acutiuscula, commonly known as the sharp-leaved honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The leaves are narrowly elliptical with a pointed tip, contributing to its common name. It produces small, fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
